descript.abstract: Superior Hiking Trail main trail, spurs, and campsite spurs for completed trail throughout Cook, Lake, St. Louis and Carlton counties. These data were collected with high-quality, realtime differentially corrected GPS units. This project was funded in part under the Coastal Zone Management Act, by NOAA's Office of Ocean and Coastal Resource Management, in conjunction with Minnesota's Lake Superior Coastal Program.
descript.purpose: This layer was created with the assistance of the DNR Division of Waters to support a variety of association management activities as well as other agency planning and management needs.

timeperd.current: Data will be added as more segments of the trail are completed.

place.placekey: Minnesota, Superior Hiking Trail, Lake Superior, Cook County, Lake County, St. Louis County, Carlton County, North Shore, Duluth, Two Harbors, Beaver Bay, Silver Bay, Schroeder, Tofte, Lutsen, Grand Marais, Hovland

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Parks and Trails, Information Systems Team

dataqual.logic: Data have been verified to be topologically correct using ArcGIS tools.
dataqual.complete: All existing Superior Hiking Trail Association resources have been collected. Updates will be made as new trail segments and resources are developed or improved.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal position accuracy is determined by the data collecting GPS unit, almost entirely Trimble Realtime or Post Differentially Corrected GPS Units. 1-3 meters on average .

procstep.procdesc: This dataset is derived and regularly updated from the DNR WHEELS Database.

enttyp.enttypd: Attribute table. Field names refer to the actual names of fields in the table; displayed field names (aliases) are defined in the field definition where applicable.

attr.attrdef: Field alias: Trail Type. Type or purpose of trail segment (for example, main trail, trail spur, trail to campsite).
Field alias: Length (Miles). Length of trail segment in miles.
Length of trail segment in meters.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Parks and Trails, Information Systems Team
